result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas S Pingel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Case No.: 13CM1167 also dismissed but read in

supervisions.notes: Restitution amended to $1,588 plus 10% surcharge per Amended Restitution Summary & Order 7/2014

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall have no contact with any of the victims listed in the complaint: Keenan K., Kimberely C., Barrington D. and Vaugn W. or any Shopko located in Washington County.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.
Defendant shall take all medications as prescribed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall not associate with known drug dealers or users or be present where drugs are illegally purchased, sold or consumed. 
Defendant shall have no contact with K.K., K.C., I.S. or B.D. or their residences.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.  
Defendant shall take all medications as prescribed.
Defendant shall notify health care providers of substance abuse history.

Any outstanding financials shall be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.  
$243 court costs imposed in 16-CM-494 shall be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.
If Extended Supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and treatment for mental health issues.

Same appearances;   Clerk: MS; Hearing re: Def's ability to pay restitution; Statements from Counsel, State; Court accepts counsel's statements as offers of proof, finds the def does have the ability to pay

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Atty Mark D Bensen for State.  Clerk: MS; On a plea to ct. 2, 4, 6 & 7, State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 1, 3, 5 and Case 13CM1167, Court so orders;    No contest plea entered on Ct. 2, 4 & 6;   Guilty plea entered on Ct. 7,  Court questions def, accepts pleas, finds def guily; joint recommendation; Argument from State, counsel; Restitution hearing requested based on Def's ability to pay; Court proceeds to sentencing.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Atty Mark D Bensen for State.  Defense withdraws NGI plea.  Adjourned for plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Hearing on May 28, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Atty Mark D Bensen for State.  Discussion regarding findings of doctor's report; Defendant informs he is competent.  State and defense waive any further opportunity to present any further evidence.  Court finds Defendant competent and reinstates criminal proceedings.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Not guilty/NGI plea entered.  Court orders NGI examination to be completed by Dr. Pankiewicz.  Hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Court orders competency examination - conducted at the Jail. Report must be completed 7 days prior to the adj date  Hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.
No contact with KC, KK, BK, VW; No possession of controlled substance without valid prescription
Hearing on March 19, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya Perez-Reyes from the  State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.   Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court sets $1000.00 cash bond.  Atty Schmaus was appointed to represent Def on Br. 2 case 13CM1167, anticipates that he will be appointed on this case as well;  Discussion re: Def's correct address, Def provided incorrect address in court for Br. 2 case;  Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing   Hearing scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 08:15 am.
